result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas William Stark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lucas William Stark
Current: 1437 N. 65th St., Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 05-14-2019)
Prior: 1736 S. 2nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 25 days in the House of Correction, with 25 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 7/29/2019.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution in the amount of $700.00 payable to Milwaukee County paid by 7/29/2019.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail to apply first to restitution. 


Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: 

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with attorney James Gregory McCann.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense requests modification of bail. State objects. Arguments heard. Court DENIED defense request. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2019 at 08:30 am.

State requested a Bench Warrant.  Defense advised that Defendant HAS made TWO (2) appointments with JusticePoint and requested that any Warrant issued be STAYED. Defendant Lucas William Stark in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Lucas William Stark in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, branch 33.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for scheduling in Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
